election_record.label: Massachusetts 1801 Governor

overview.note: "By the latest return of votes for Governor, it is probable that Mr. Strong is again chosen Governor, altho' we were sanguine that Mr. GERRY would have obtained the election. The republicans have, however, the satisfaction of noticing by the returns, that those parts of the Commonwealth where the people were the best informed of the nature of the political controversy, Mr. GERRY has had a decided majority. Witness the towns of Boston, Charlestown, Marblehead, Cambridge, Worcester, etc. etc. It is also ascertained that the Counties of Suffolk, Middlesex, Norfolk, Plymouth and Berkshire, are found in the republican faith.--It is not Men who are the object of the controversy, but it is Principles. However respectable His Excellency Governor Strong may be in private life (and we have no disposition to detract from his real merit) we cannot yet be convinced that he has rendered so important services in obtaining and preserving the freedom and independence of this Country as his opponenet, or that he is equally strong in genuine republicanism. However, should he obtain the election, the old principle, vox populi, vox dei will teach us duly to appreciate and cheerfully to acquiesce in his administration." The Sun (Pittsfield, MA). April 21, 1801.

"A number of persons belonging to other towns were detected in giving votes for Mr. GERRY. The names of several are ascertained. This may account for the very extraordinary increase of the voters this year for the gentleman, in Boston. A letter from Medford assures us, that three Medford men boasted on Monday last, of their having voted in Boston for Mr. Gerry; and one of them that he put in two votes." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). April 8, 1801.

sub_unit.name: Falmouth
sub_unit.note: Falmouth Town Records report 10 votes for Caleb Strong and 120 votes for Elbridge Gerry.

sub_unit.name: New Ashford
sub_unit.note: The votes from New Ashford were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Stockbridge
sub_unit.note: The votes from Stockbridge were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Deer Isle
sub_unit.note: The votes from Deer Isle were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Mount Desert
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Mount Desert.

sub_unit.name: Sedgwick
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Sedgwick.

sub_unit.name: Cornville
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Cornville.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: Warren Town Records list 72 votes for Caleb Strong and 21 votes for Elbridge Gerry.

sub_unit.name: Reading
sub_unit.note: The votes from Reading were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Middleborough
sub_unit.note: Caleb Strong received 1 vote as Strong Caleb.
